Title: Next Generation Radar (NEXRAD) Locations
Description: This geospatial rendering of weather radar sites gives access to an historical archive of Terminal Doppler Weather Radar data and is used primarily for research purposes. The archived data includes base data and derived products of the National Weather Service (NWS) Weather Surveillance Radar 88 Doppler (WSR-88D) next generation (NEXRAD) weather radar.  Weather radar detects the three meteorological base data quantities: reflectivity, mean radial velocity, and spectrum width.  From these quantities, computer processing generates numerous meteorological analysis products for forecasts, archiving and dissemination.  There are 159 operational  NEXRAD radar systems deployed throughout the United States and at selected overseas locations.  At the Radar Operations Center (ROC) in Norman OK, personnel from the NWS, Air Force, Navy, and FAA use this distributed weather radar system to collect the data needed to warn of impending severe weather and possible flash floods; support air traffic safety and assist in the management of air traffic flow control; facilitate resource protection at military bases; and optimize the management of water, agriculture, forest, and snow removal.  This data set is jointly owned by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Federal Aviation Administration, and Department of Defense.
Keywords: NEXRAD, WSR-88D, weather, radar, precipitation, tornado, hurricane, flood, reflectivity, rainrate, historical archive, radar scans, storm events, federal data download, federal datasets, reflectivity, mean radial velocity, spectrum
Citation: Historical NEXRAD and TDWR Radar Data

Title: Residential Energy Consumption Survey (RECS) Files, All Data, 2005
Description: The Residential Energy Consumption Survey (RECS), which is conducted every four years, provides national statistical survey data on the use of energy in residential housing units including physical housing unit types, appliances utilized, demographics, fuels, and other energy use information. This dataset (i.e., the full RECS dataset) is very large in size and may require specialized software to open on your computer. The file might not open completely in Excel 2003 or earlier versions. For a subset of the data pertaining only to Energy Consumption component of RECS, please go to: http://www.data.gov/details/59
Keywords: Residential energy consumption data, energy consumption, energy use, Household use of energy, data, federal data download, national, housing, appliances, RECS data, energy, federal datasets, energy data, statistics
Granularity: RECS data are tabulated for the four Census regions, the nine Census divisions, and for the four most populous States--California, Florida, New York, and Texas.
Collection Mode: The survey collected data from 4,382 households sampled at random using a complex multistage, area-probability design to represent 111.1 million U.S. households, the Census Bureau's statistical estimate for all occupied housing units in 2005. Data were obtained from residential energy suppliers for each unit in the sample to produce the Consumption and Expenditures data.

Title: Geographical Information System Graphical Database of Tornados 1950-2006
Description: This data from the National Weather Service provides Geographic Information System (GIS) graphical representations of tornados, large hail events, and damaging wind reports in the Continental United States for the period 1950 through 2006.  The data provided are in .zip files that are generally around 50 MB.  Although available to all, the data provided may be of particular value to weather professionals and students of meteorological sciences.  An instructional manual is provided on how to build and develop a basic severe weather report GIS database in ArcGis and is located at the technical documentation site contained in this metadata catalog.
Keywords: Tornado database 1950-2006,federal datasets, federal data download,Severe, Weather, GIS,environment, Severe Weather, GIS,storms, thunderstorms,twister, funnel, hail ,wind, wind damage

Title: Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Observations (CoCoRaHS)
Description: The National Weather Service (NWS) supports the Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow (CoCoRaHS) network.  CoCoRaHS is a unique, non-profit, community-based network of volunteers of all ages and backgrounds working together to measure and map precipitation (rain, snow and hail). The network has over 6,500 observers in 26 states. Once trained, volunteers collect data using standardized, low cost measuring tools such as a 4-inch diameter high capacity rain gage, snow boards to measure snow, and aluminum foil-wrapped Styrofoam hail pads in some states. This site has been compiled by NWS and contains the results of the observations and data collection activities of these volunteers across a broad swath of the United States.
Keywords: Rain, snow, hail, amount, GIS, KML, federal datasets, federal data download, Severe, Weather, GIS, environment, kml, kmz, snowfall, weather, forecast, Severe Weather, Storms

Description: The National Weather Service (NWS) National Operational Hydrologic Remote Sensing Center (NOHRSC) provides comprehensive snow observations, analyses, data sets and map products.  Available to all, these products specifically support a wide variety of government and private-sector applications in water resource management, disaster and emergency preparedness, weather and flood forecasting, agriculture, transportation, and commerce.
Keywords: Snow cover, snow density, snow depth, remote sensing, GIS, federal datasets, federal data download, environment, precipitation, water, kml

Title: Past Atlantic Storm Tracks
Description: The National Weather Service (NWS) maintains historical Atlantic Ocean hurricane weather data in a format that can be exploited by Graphic Information System (GIS) software. Using KML/KMZ formats, it takes the numbers and words from the rows and columns in databases and spreadsheets and puts them on a map.  This data file contains information about named and unnamed Altantic tropical storms and hurricanes from 1851 to 2006.  Once downloaded, the file can be decompiled by decade and by year in a a KML/KMZ GIS viewer.
Keywords: tropical storm path, tropical storm track, tropical storm GIS, hurricane, federal datasets, federal data download, environment, kml, hurricane, cyclone, tropical storm, tracking, Hurricane Preparedness , emergencies
Geographic Coverage: Atlantic High Seas, Caribbean , Gulf of Mexico, Continental United States

Title: Database of Tornado, Large Hail, and Damaging Wind Reports, 1950-2006
Description: The National Weather Service (NWS) Storm Prediction Center (SPC) routinely collects reports of severe weather and compiles them with public access from the database called SeverePlot (Hart and Janish 1999) with a Geographic Information System (GIS).  The composite SVRGIS information is made available to the public primarily in .zip files of approximately 50MB size.  The files located at the access point contain composite track information regarding tornados, large hail, and damaging winds for the period 1950-2006.  Although available to all, the data provided may be of particular value to weather professionals and students of meteorological sciences.  An instructional manual is provided on how to build and develop a basic severe weather report GIS database in ArcGis and is located at the technical documentation site contained in this metadata catalog.

Title: USGS Global Visualization Viewer for Aerial and Satellite Data
Frequency: 16-days;  Any given area is potentially imaged once every 16 days; images are added to the collection several times daily
Description: Ten million archive images of the Earth's surface are available for immediate selection and free download via the USGS Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center's Global Visualization Viewer at http://glovis.usgs.gov/. Users can preview thumbnail browse images and download full-image selections from 1.5 million aerial photos of U.S. sites and 8.5 million images captured worldwide by U.S. Earth-observing satellites.
Keywords: Landsat, satellite, ETM+, MSS, TM, Multispectral Scanner, Enhanced Thematic Mapper, Thematic Mapper, remote sensing, earth observations
Citation: http://edc.usgs.gov/about/customer/citation.html There are no restrictions on data received from the U.S. Geological Survey's Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center, unless expressly identified prior to or at the time of receipt. Depending on the product source, we request that the following statements be used when citing, copying, or reprinting data: USGS Products Acknowledgement: Data available from the U.S. Geological Survey. See USGS Visual Identity System Guidance for further details. Questions concerning the use or redistribution of USGS data should be directed to: ask@usgs.gov or 1-888-ASK-USGS (1-888-275-8747).
Unit of Analysis: Each Landsat image collected is a scene. Each Landsat scene is 115 x 106 miles long. The globe is divided into 57,784 scenes, and each Landsat scene has about 3 billion bytes of data.
Granularity: 15-meter to 120-meter pixels depending on the instrument used
Collection Mode: satellite and satellite ground station antennas and related equipment

Title: National Water Information System (NWIS)

Description: NWIS supports the acquisition, processing, storage and dissemination of information about water quantity and quality collected at over 1.5 million sites around the U.S. As a long-term database and information delivery system, NWIS provides continual access to data collected over the last 100+ years, as well as real-time data on streamflow, etc.
Keywords: water resources, water data, ground water, groundwater, surface water, water quality, water chemistry, real-time water data, streamflow, water level, NWIS

Granularity: coordinate: latitude,  longitude and depth below land surface in some cases like ground water or lakes.

Title: NPS Focus Digital Library and Research Station
Time Period: This is an ongoing, accumulative information system covering time intervals for 390+ parks and the NPS itself.
Description: Scope: National.  NPS Focus Digital Library and Research Station information system manages images and archives of images as well as documents described by linked metadata and provides cross-repository searching of library catalogs within and external to the NPS.  The NPS Focus system is composed of two separate but integrated subsystems: * The NPS Focus Digital Library is a digital resource metadata and file management system. It can be used to store images and documents for search and display through the NPS Focus GUI or as a web service to other systems. * NPS Focus Research Station provides a portal to search across numerous NPS systems including its own digital library of images and documents.
Keywords: National Park Service, image, document, library, catalog, National Register of Historic Places, Facilities Management, Project Management Information System, Recovery Act, American Reinvestment and Recovery Act, ARRA
Citation: NPS Focus Information System, Resource Information Services Division, National Information Systems Center, Office of the Chief Information Officer, National Park Service, http://npsfocus.nps.gov.
Agency Data Series Page: No external landing page - use http://npsfocus.nps.gov. Internal landing page is http://inside.nps.gov
Unit of Analysis: Object, document, or collection of related objects or documents.
Geographic Coverage: National Park Service system-wide which includes all of U.S. and affiliated sites worldwide.
Additional Metadata: NPS Systems Inventory (internal access only): http://inside.nps.gov/index.cfm?handler=SystemsInventoryDetails&SystemID=107483753&SysAcronym=; NPS Focus 'About' page: http://focus.inside.nps.gov/docs/Inside/About.html; NPS Focus Help System: http://focus.inside.nps.gov/docs/Inside/Help.html.

Title: Federal Register
Date Updated: Monday through Friday, except Federal holidays.
Description: The Federal Register is the official daily publication for rules, proposed rules, and notices of Federal agencies and organizations, as well as executive orders and other presidential documents. Published by the Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), it is updated daily and is available Monday through Friday, except Federal holidays. GPO's Federal Digital System (FDsys) contains Federal Register issues from 1994 to the present. \n \nThe current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Federal Register. Only the PDF and Text versions have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Federal Register. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Federal Register on FDsys.gov. The FDsys data set includes digitally signed Federal Register PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law. See: http://www.fdsys.gov/fdsys/browse/collection.action?collectionCode=FR
Keywords: Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), rules, regulations, proposed rules, notices, directives, guidelines, rule makings, meetings, presidential executive orders and proclamations
Unit of Analysis: Notices, proposed rules, rules and regulations, presidential documents
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)

Title: American FactFinder
Frequency: Decennial - Every 10 Years, Quinquennial - Every 5 years, Annual
Description: American FactFinder is the U.S. Census Bureau's online, self-service tool designed to search the American Community Survey,Puerto Rico Community Survey,Decennial Census, Economic Census,Nonemployer Statistics, Annual Survey of Manufactures,County Business Patterns,ZIP Code Business Patterns,Population Estimates.  It delivers a wide variety of population, economic, geographic and housing information about the United States, Puerto Rico and the Island areas to individuals, businesses, governments, and organizations. It provides easy access to accurate, relevant and timely information that supports learning, facilitates decision-making, empowers individuals and strengthens communities.
Keywords: Demographic, population, age, sex, disability, education, employment, income, ancestry, language, poverty, race, ethnicity, Hispanic origin, relationships, veteran status, grandparents, marital status, fertility, school enrollment, housing, tenure, renters, owners, physical characteristics, financial characteristics, number of rooms, household size, family type, Economic, business, industry, mining, utilities, construction, manufacturing, wholesale trade, retail trade, transportation and warehousing, information, finance and insurance, real estate and rental and leasing, professional and scientific and technical services, management of companies and enterprises, administrative and support and waste management and remediation services, educational services, health care and social assistance, art and entertainment and recreation, accomodation and food services, other services, establishments, sales, shipment, receipts, number of employees, payroll
Unit of Analysis: Multiple based on specific data set of interest.
Granularity: Multiple based on specific data set of interest including, national, regional, state, county, local and block level. Statistical and political geographic hierarchies are available.
Geographic Coverage: United States,Puerto Rico,U.S. Virgin Islands, Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam,American Samoa
Collection Mode: Multiple based on specific data set of interest.

Title: DataFerrett
Time Period: Varies depending on collection, from 1989 - Present
Frequency: CPS monthly, SIPP continuous, AHS annual, Fish & Hunt every 2 Years, LED quarterly, ACS continous collection released annually.
Description: The DataFerrett tool is used to search American Community Survey Public Use Microdata, Current Population Survey(CPS), CPS supplemental surveys,  Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP), SIPP Topical Module surveys, Survey of Program Dynamics, the American Housing Survey, National Survey of Fishing, Hunting, and Wildlife Associated Recreation, The New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey, Local Employment Dynamics.  It is an online analytically oriented, self-service tool designed to deliver a wide variety of population, health, economic, geographic and housing information about the United States to individuals, businesses, governments, and organizations. This tool provides easy access to accurate, relevant and timely information that supports learning, facilitates decision-making, empowers individuals, and strengthens communities.
Keywords: Demographic, population, age, sex, disability, education, employment, earnings, hourly pay, overtime, tempary job, job tenure, job search, unemployment insurance, Health Insurance, TANF, WIC, alimony payments, social security payments, unemployment benefits, pension benefits, Civil Service Pension, Interest Earnings, Stocks and Mutial Funds, Financial Assets, Medical Expenses, Real Estate, Rental Properties, Mortgage, Retirement Assets, income, ancestry, language, poverty, race, ethnicity, Hispanic origin, relationships, veteran status, grandparents, marital status, marital history, family, fertility, number of live births, year last child born, school enrollment, Food Security, child not eating enough, total spent for food, food stamps, free or reduced lunch, Head Start, Child Care, Child Well being, child disability, Adult Disability, health insurance ineligible, housing, housing tenure, rental, owners, physical characteristics, financial characteristics,  number of rooms, household size, Condition of Neighborhood, Accessibililty and Health Issues, Condition of Building, Vacant Housing Characteristics.
Unit of Analysis: Multiple universes, based on specific data set of interest, including person, household, and establishment.
Granularity: Multiple, based on specific data set of interest including, national, regional, state, county, and city. Statistical and political geographic hierarchies are available.

Title: Cancer Incidence - Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Registries Limited-Use
Agency: Department of Health and Human Services
Description: SEER Limited-Use cancer incidence data with associated population data. Geographic areas available are county and SEER registry.  The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program of the National Cancer Institute collects and distributes high quality, comprehensive cancer data from a number of population-based cancer registries. Data include patient demographics, primary tumor site, morphology, stage at diagnosis, first course of treatment, and follow-up for vital status. The SEER Program is the only comprehensive source of population-based information in the United States that includes stage of cancer at the time of diagnosis and survival rates within each stage.

Title: National Postsecondary Student Aid Study (NPSAS)
Description: A survey of student financing of postsecondary education in the United States. Undergraduate and\ngraduate students enrolled at all types of postsecondary institutions in the U.S. in 2007-08 are represented. Title: Airline On-Time Performance and Causes of Flight Delays
Description: This table contains on-time arrival data for non-stop domestic flights by major air carriers, and provides such additional items as departure and arrival delays, origin and destination airports, flight numbers, scheduled and actual departure and arrival times, cancelled or diverted flights, taxi-out and taxi-in times, air time, and non-stop distance.
Keywords: monthly on-time performance data, airlines, domestic air travel, delays
Citation: Airline On-time Performance and Causes of Flight Delays - Download Monthly On-Time Data, Bureau of Transportation Statistics, Research and Innovative Technology Administration, United States Department of Transportation
Unit of Analysis: Airline flights classified by scheduled vs actual date/time of departure/arrival, aircraft identifier, airline, origin, destination, causes of delays/cancellations/diversions
Collection Mode: Reporting Carriers are required under 14 CFR 234 to report on-time performance data directly to BTS. See Accounting and Reporting directive 17.
Statistical Methodology: A complete enumeration of flights by reporting carriers.

Title: North American TransBorder Freight Monthly and Annual Summary Data
Description: The North American Transborder Freight Database contains freight flow data by commodity type and by mode of transportation (rail, truck, pipeline, air, vessel, and other) for U.S. exports to and imports from Canada and Mexico.  It allows users to analyze movement of merchandise by all land modes, waterborne vessels, and by air carriers.
Keywords: freight data, Canada, Mexico, United States, NAFTA, port of entry, export, import, trade, commodity
Citation: The North American Transborder Freight Database contains freight flow data by commodity type and by mode of transportation (rail, truck, pipeline, air, vessel, and other) for U.S. exports to and imports from Canada and Mexico.  It allows users to analyze movement of merchandise by all land modes, waterborne vessels, and by air carriers.
Unit of Analysis: International trade data by export or import, port of entry, mode of transportation, commodity, value, weight, freight charges, month and year.
Granularity: Canadian Province, U.S. State, Mexican State, U.S. Port of Entry
Collection Mode: Electronic transmission by exporters and importers to the Census Bureau and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) respectively.  CBP then sends export data to Census.  There is also a data exchange between Census and Statistics Canada, where the Census Bureau receives data on U.S. exports to Canada.
Statistical Methodology: A complete enumeration of trade related documents collected by the U.S. Customs and Border Protection

Title: SESTAT
Description: National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), National Survey of Recent College Graduates (NSRCG), Survey of Doctorate Recipients (SDR)
Keywords: US science and engineering workforce, scientists and engineers, field of degree, bachelor's degree, master's degree, doctoral degree, doctorate, employment in science and engineering, S&E,
Citation: The Scientists and Engineers Statistical Data System (SESTAT) is an integrated data collection effort capturing information about employment, educational, and demographic characteristics of scientists and engineers in the United States. The data are collected from three national surveys of this population: the National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), the National Survey of Recent College Graduates (NSRCG), and the Survey of Doctorate Recipients (SDR).   URL: http://www.nsf.gov/statistics/sestat/
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: National Science Foundation/Division of Science Resources Statistics

Title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey MEPSnet Insurance Component (MEPSnet/IC)
Agency: Department of Health and Human Services
Subagency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality
Description: The MEPS-IC is an annual survey of establishments that collects information about employer-sponsored health insurance offerings in the United States. With MEPSnet/IC you have easy access to national and state-level statistics and trends about employer-based health insurance. It provides statistics and trends about health insurance offered by private establishments as well as national and regional health insurance estimates for State and local governments. MEPSnet/IC guides you through a step-by-step process to obtain the statistics you need. MEPSnet/IC generates statistics using the 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, and 2006 data from the MEPS Insurance Component Tables.
Keywords: health insurance premiums, health insurance enrollees, employer-based health insurance, health insurance, health insurance plans
Citation: Center for Financing, Access, and Cost Trends. Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality. Insurance Component of the Medical Expenditure Panel Survey. MEPSnet/IC  http://www.meps.ahrq.gov/mepsweb/data_stats/MEPSnetIC.jsp. [Date of access]
Unit of Analysis: private establishments, state and local governments
Granularity: State and selected metro areas within state
Collection Mode: Telephone prescreener, mail questionnaires, telephone follow-up
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality
Statistical Methodology: Several helpful links are provided on the MEPS Insurance Component page http://www.meps.ahrq.gov/mepsweb/survey_comp/Insurance.jsp
Disclosure Avoidance: Responsibility of the U.S. Census Bureau, the MEPS IC data collection agency
Series Breaks: In preparation for improvements in the data collection process, 2007 data for the Insurance Component was not collected
Statistical Characteristics: Standard errors are provided for all estimates posted on the MEPS Web site.

Title: Wide-ranging Online Data for Epidemiologic Research (WONDER)
Agency: Department of Health and Human Services
Subagency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Time Period: The time intervals vary with the data set, some are annual, some are monthly, some are weekly.
Frequency: The data collections are updated at various time intervals, some annually, some quarterly, some monthly, some weekly.
Description: WONDER online databases include county-level Compressed Mortality (death certificates) since 1979; county-level Multiple Cause of Death (death certificates) since 1999; county-level Natality (birth certificates) since 1995; county-level Linked Birth / Death records (linked birth-death certificates) since 1995;  state & large metro-level United States Cancer Statistics mortality (death certificates) since 1999;  state & large metro-level United States Cancer Statistics incidence (cancer registry cases) since 1999; state and metro-level Online Tuberculosis Information System (TB case reports) since 1993;  state-level Sexually Transmitted Disease  Morbidity (case reports) since 1984; state-level Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting system (adverse reaction case reports) since 1990; county-level population estimates since 1970.  The WONDER web server also hosts the Data2010 system with state-level data for compliance with Healthy People 2010 goals since 1998; the National Notifiable Disease Surveillance System weekly provisional case reports since 1996; the 122 Cities Mortality Reporting System weekly death reports since 1996;  the Prevention Guidelines database (book in electronic format) published 1998; the Scientific Data Archives (public use data sets and documentation); and links to other online data sources on the "Topics" page.
Keywords: births, deaths, disease incidence, health event case reports, demographic information
Unit of Analysis: The implicit universe varies with the data set, the end-user determines the record layout for data extracts.
Granularity: County-level FIPS codes, MSA level FIPS codes.
Geographic Coverage: United  States national, US state & territories, US regions & divisions, US states and counties, US MSAs (metropolitan statistical areas).
Collection Mode: Varies with data set, most likely to be electronic web reporting.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (US HHS / CDC)
Statistical Methodology: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Sampling: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Estimation: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Weighting: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Disclosure Avoidance: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Questionnaire Design: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Series Breaks: End-user can define the category breaks.
Non-response Adjustment: Varies with data set, as specified by the data steward.
Statistical Characteristics: Varies with the data set, as specified by the data steward.

Title: USA Spending Contracts and Purchases
Description: Provides US Federal Spending by agency. The Contracts section allows searching for data relating to all Federal contracts. There are three main categories of searches: by contractor, by location, and by contracting agency. The Purchase section allows users to view purchase cards spending of various federal agencies for each fiscal year. The data available on this website are extracted from the report published once every quarter on the GSA SmartPay website. The GSA SmartPay receives this data directly from the banks that issued the purchase cards.
Keywords: Federal contracts, Contracts, Awards, Grants, Loans, Assistance, Purchase Cards, GSASmartPay, GSA SmartPay, USASpending, USA Spending, Purchase, Travel, Fleet, contractor, contracting agency, American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, Recovery Act, ARRA, Top 100 contractors, federal assistance,  insurance, direct payments, recipient, place of performance, Top 100 Recipients, acquisition, transaction, Original Subsidy Cost, Face Value, Direct Loan, Guaranteed Loan, FPDS, Federal Procurement Data System, FAADS,  Federal Assistance Award Data System

Title: USA Spending Grants and Loans
Description: Provides US Federal Spending by agency. The Grants section allows visitors to search for information about federal assistance; including grants, insurance, direct payments, and other. Information about federal loan spending can be found on the Loans section, which allows visitors to search for information about different federal loan categories, including Direct Loans and Guaranteed Loans.
Keywords: Federal contracts, Contracts, Awards, Grants, Loans, Assistance, Purchase Cards, GSASmartPay, GSA SmartPay, USASpending, USA Spending, Purchase, Travel, Fleet, contractor, contracting agency, American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, Recovery Act, ARRA, Top 100 contractors, federal assistance,  insurance, direct payments, recipient, place of performance, Top 100 Recipients, acquisition, transaction, Original Subsidy Cost, Face Value, Direct Loan, Guaranteed Loan, FPDS, Federal Procurement Data System, FAADS,  Federal Assistance Award Data System

Keywords: TRI, TRI Data, TRI Reporting, Toxic, Toxics, Toxic Release, Toxics Release, Toxic Release Inventory, Toxics Release Inventory, Chemical, Chemicals, Chemical Release, Chemical Pollution, EPCRA, EPCRA 313, section 313, TRI State Data, Hazardous, Right to Know, Form R, Form A, pollution prevention, waste management, source reduction, community, community right to know, toxic chemical release inventory, toxic chemicals release inventory, facility, facilities
Citation: Toxics Release Inventory data for the state of Virginia, http://www.epa.gov/tri/tridata/tri05/data/VA_2005_v05.exe
Unit of Analysis: Quantities and other characteristics of  releases and other waste management activities (recycling, energy recovery and treatement) for a single TRI chemical by a TRI qualifying facility.
Collection Mode: Paper forms, floppy diskettes, CDs and internet submissions
Data Collection Instrument: Paper Forms and Instructions available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/index.htm; Diskette, CD and Internet Submissions via the TRI-ME Desktop Application - Application available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/software/trimecd/index.htm; Internet submission through the TRI-ME web application - Access available through EPA's Centeral Data Exchange (CDX) at http://cdx.epa.gov

Keywords: TRI, TRI Data, TRI Reporting, Toxic, Toxics, Toxic Release, Toxics Release, Toxic Release Inventory, Toxics Release Inventory, Chemical, Chemicals, Chemical Release, Chemical Pollution, EPCRA, EPCRA 313, section 313, TRI State Data, Hazardous, Right to Know, Form R, Form A, pollution prevention, waste management, source reduction, community, community right to know, toxic chemical release inventory, toxic chemicals release inventory, facility, facilities
Citation: Toxics Release Inventory data for the state of Wyoming, http://www.epa.gov/tri/tridata/tri06/data/WY_2006_v06.exe
Unit of Analysis: Quantities and other characteristics of  releases and other waste management activities (recycling, energy recovery and treatement) for a single TRI chemical by a TRI qualifying facility.
Collection Mode: Paper forms, floppy diskettes, CDs and internet submissions
Data Collection Instrument: Paper Forms and Instructions available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/index.htm; Diskette, CD and Internet Submissions via the TRI-ME Desktop Application - Application available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/software/trimecd/index.htm; Internet submission through the TRI-ME web application - Access available through EPA's Centeral Data Exchange (CDX) at http://cdx.epa.gov

Keywords: TRI, TRI Data, TRI Reporting, Toxic, Toxics, Toxic Release, Toxics Release, Toxic Release Inventory, Toxics Release Inventory, Chemical, Chemicals, Chemical Release, Chemical Pollution, EPCRA, EPCRA 313, section 313, TRI State Data, Hazardous, Right to Know, Form R, Form A, pollution prevention, waste management, source reduction, community, community right to know, toxic chemical release inventory, toxic chemicals release inventory, facility, facilities
Citation: Toxics Release Inventory data for the state of Kansas, http://www.epa.gov/tri/tridata/tri07/data/statedata07/KS_2007_v07.exe
Unit of Analysis: Quantities and other characteristics of  releases and other waste management activities (recycling, energy recovery and treatement) for a single TRI chemical by a TRI qualifying facility.
Collection Mode: Paper forms, floppy diskettes, CDs and internet submissions
Data Collection Instrument: Paper Forms and Instructions available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/index.htm; Diskette, CD and Internet Submissions via the TRI-ME Desktop Application - Application available at http://www.epa.gov/tri/report/software/trimecd/index.htm; Internet submission through the TRI-ME web application - Access available through EPA's Centeral Data Exchange (CDX) at http://cdx.epa.gov

Title: Research Spending and Results
Description: Research.gov Research Spending and Results is an online, user-friendly platform to access and search detailed information about federally funded science and engineering research and education, giving the general public, the scientific community and Congress visibility into the results achieved with federally-funded  research.  Research awards are easily searchable by agency, awardee, award amount and date, state and congressional district (where award was made and the work is being performed), and key word such as a field of science.  Information can be reviewed online or exported to various file formats, such as XML, CSV and XLS.  Detailed information on federally funded research can be found for multiple agencies.  Information provided for each award includes: * Award recipient (institution and researcher), * Award Amount and funds obligated to date, * Period of Performance, * State and Congressional district of where the award was made and where the work is being performed., * Award Abstract describing the research effort, * Citations of Journals Published as a result of the award
Keywords: Science and engineering research and education, National Science Foundation, National Aeronautics Space Administration, STEM, science, technology, engineering, mathematics, award, grant, cooperative agreement, research spending, research results, institution, federally-funded research, state, congressional district, principal investigator, award abstract, publication citation, conference proceeding citation
Unit of Analysis: Award recipient - an organization or individual
Data Collection Instrument: Electronic Proposal and Award Management Systems (http://www.fastlane.nsf.gov; http://nspires.nasaprs.com)

Title: Business Employment Dynamics
Time Period: Changes in employment from the third month of one quarter to the third month of the next
Description: Business Employment Dynamics is a set of statistics generated from the Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages, or ES-202, program. These quarterly data series consist of gross job gains and gross job losses statistics from 1992 forward. These data help to provide a picture of the dynamic state of the labor market.
Keywords: Business Employment Dynamics, Closing establishments, Contracting establishments, Employment dynamics, business Expanding establishments, Gross job gains, Gross job losses, Opening establishments
Unit of Analysis: Closing establishments, Contracting establishments, business Expanding establishments, Gross job gains, Gross job losses, Opening establishments

Title: Employment, Hours, and Earnings from the Current Employment Statistics survey (National)
Time Period: Employment and wages for the pay period including the 12th of the month
Description: Each month the Current Employment Statistics (CES) program surveys about 150,000 businesses and government agencies, representing approximately 390,000 individual worksites, in order to provide detailed industry data on employment, hours, and earnings of workers on nonfarm payrolls.
Keywords: Average hourly earnings, Average weekly earnings, Current Employment Statistics, Establishment survey, Hours, average weekly,  National employment statistics, Strike Report, Experimental all employee hours and earnings series, national, Employment and earnings (establishment data).
Unit of Analysis: Average hourly earnings, Average weekly earnings, Hours, average weekly,  national, Employment and earnings.

Title: Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages
Time Period: Employment for the pay period including the 12th of the month and wages for a calendar quarter
Description: The Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) program publishes a quarterly count of employment and wages reported by employers covering 98 percent of U.S. jobs, available at the county, MSA, state and national levels by industry.
Keywords: Average annual wages, Average weekly wages (by county), Census of Employment and Wages, Quarterly County Employment and Wages, Employment and Wages, Quarterly Census of ES 202, Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW)
Unit of Analysis: Average annual wages, Average weekly wages (by county), Employment and Wages.

Title: Consumer Expenditure Survey
Time Period: Quarterly Interview Survey and weekly Diary Survey
Description: The Consumer Expenditure Survey (CE) program consists of two surveys, the quarterly Interview Survey and the Diary Survey, that provide information on the buying habits of American consumers, including data on their expenditures, income, and consumer unit (families and single consumers) characteristics. The survey data are collected for the Bureau of Labor Statistics by the U.S. Census Bureau.
Keywords: Consumer expenditures, Consumer spending

Title: Consumer Price Index
Description: The Consumer Price Indexes (CPI) program produces monthly data on changes in the prices paid by urban consumers for a representative basket of goods and services.
Keywords: Consumer price indexes, Retail Inflation, Retail price index
Unit of Analysis: Consumer price indexes, Retail Inflation, Retail price index

Title: Labor Force Statistics from the Current Population Survey
Time Period: Week that includes the 12th day of the month
Description: The Current Population Survey (CPS) is a monthly survey of households conducted by the Bureau of Census for the Bureau of Labor Statistics. It provides a comprehensive body of data on the: labor force, employment, unemployment and persons not in the labor force.
Keywords: Current Population Survey (CPS), Household survey, National Labor force statistics, NationalDemographic labor force data, NationalEmployment by demographics, Educational attainment,  College enrollment and work activity of high school graduates,  College enrollment and work activity of High school graduates, Marital and family data, Foreign-born workers, Older workers,  Statistics on Hispanic workers, Minority workers,  Statistics on workers by Race, Veterans, Volunteering (statistics from CPS), Youth,  Usual weekly earnings,  Earnings by demographics, Women's earnings, Minimum wage workers, Poverty: profile of the working poor Absences from work,  Contingent workers, Discouraged workers, Displaced workers, Part-time workers, Hours of work by demographics, Labor force status flows research series, Multiple jobholders,  Not in the labor force,  Flexible and shift schedules, Shift work, Self-employed workers, Summer work, Employee tenure,  Job tenure, Tenure, National Unemployment statistics,  Union membership,  Work experience,  Home-based work,  Work at home (statistics from CPS), Employment and earnings (household data).
Unit of Analysis: Household survey, National Labor force statistics, National Demographic labor force data, National Employment by demographics, Educational attainment,   Usual weekly earnings,  Earnings by demographics, unemplyment statistics,  Employment and earnings.

Title: Employee Benefits Survey
Description: National Compensation Survey - Benefits produces comprehensive data on the incidence (the percentage of workers with access to and participation in employer provided benefit plans) and provisions of selected employee benefit plans.
Keywords: Benefits, Employee benefits

Title: Employment Cost Trends
Description: National Compensation Survey - Employment Cost Trends produces quarterly indexes measuring change over time in labor costs (ECI) and quarterly data measuring level of average costs per hour worked (ECEC).
Keywords: Employment Cost Index

Title: Employment Projections
Description: The Employment Projections Program develops information about the labor market for the Nation as a whole for 10 years in the future.
Keywords: Employment projections, Industry output Projections, Labor force projections, Industry output projections, Industry employment projections, Input-output projections, Employment requirements matrix
Unit of Analysis: Employment projections, Industry output Projections, Labor force projections, Industry output projections, Industry employment projections, Input-output projections

Title: Foreign Labor Statistics
Description: The International Labor Comparisons (ILC) program provides international comparisons of hourly compensation costs; productivity and unit labor costs; labor force, employment and unemployment rates; and consumer prices. The comparisons relate primarily to the major industrial countries, but other countries are included in certain measures. Because statistical concepts and methods vary from country to country, international comparisons of statistical data can be misleading.
Keywords: International labor force, International statistics, International compensation costs, International consumer price indexes, International GDP, International productivity
Unit of Analysis: International labor force, International compensation costs, International consumer price indexes, International GDP, International productivity
Granularity: Australia, Austria Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Korea, Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
Geographic Coverage: Australia, Austria Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Korea, Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom

Title: Import/Export Price Indexes
Time Period: Monthly for goods and quarterly for services
Description: The International Price Program (IPP) produces Import/Export Price Indexes (MXP) containing data on changes in the prices of nonmilitary goods and services traded between the U.S. and the rest of the world.
Keywords: Import and Export price indexes

Title: Injuries, Illnesses, and Fatalities
Description: The Injuries, Illnesses, and Fatalities (IIF) program provides data on illnesses and injuries on the job and data on worker fatalities.
Keywords: Census of Fatal Occupational Injuries, Statistics on Workplace Fatalities, Injury and illness rates, Statistics on Injuries and illnesses, Safety and health data, Workplace violence prevention.
Unit of Analysis: Statistics on Workplace Fatalities, Injury and illness rates, Safety and health data.

Title: Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey
Time Period: Job openings on last day of month; hires and separations in entire calendar month
Description: The Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) program produces data on job openings, hires, and separations.
Keywords: Statistics on Employee turnover, Job Openings and Labor Turnover, Labor demand, Quits, Separations of workers from employers, Turnover
Unit of Analysis: Statistics on Employee turnover, Job Openings and Labor Turnover, Labor demand, Quits, Separations of workers from employers, Turnover

Title: Local Area Unemployment Statistics
Time Period: Estimates are based on several sources (including CPS and CES)
Description: The Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) program produces monthly and annual employment, unemployment, and labor force data for Census regions and divisions, States, counties, metropolitan areas, and many cities, by place of residence.
Keywords: State and area labor force statistics, Sub-State statistics, Unemployment statistics, state and area, Metropolitan areas
Unit of Analysis: State and area labor force statistics, Sub-State statistics, Unemployment statistics, state and area, Metropolitan areas

Title: Productivity and Costs
Description: The Major Sector Productivity and Costs program publishes quarterly and annual measures of output per hour and unit labor costs for the U.S. business, nonfarm business, and manufacturing sectors. These are the productivity statistics most often cited by the national media. The Industry Productivity and Costs program publishes annual measures of output per hour and unit labor costs for detailed U.S. industries.
Keywords: Industry Productivity, Labor Productivity, Statistics on Productivity, Labor productivity, Real hourly compensation in major sectors, Unit labor costs
Unit of Analysis: Industry Productivity, Labor Productivity, Statistics on Productivity, Labor productivity, Real hourly compensation in major sectors, Unit labor costs

Title: Multifactor Productivity
Description: Multifactor Productivity (MFP) measures the changes in output per unit of combined inputs. Indexes of MFP are produced for the private business, private nonfarm business, and manufacturing sectors of the economy. MFP is also developed for 18 3-digit NAICS manufacturing industry groups and 86 4-digit NAICS manufacturing industries, the air transportation industry, the railroad transportation industry, and the utility and gas industry.
Keywords: Multifactor productivity

Title: Mass Layoff Statistics
Time Period: Given month contains an aggregation of the weekly unemployment insurance claims filings for the Sunday through Saturday weeks in that month.
Description: The Mass Layoff Statistics (MLS) program collects reports on mass layoff actions that result in workers being separated from their jobs. Monthly mass layoff numbers are from establishments which have at least 50 initial claims for unemployment insurance (UI) filed against them during a 5-week period. Extended mass layoff numbers (issued quarterly) are from a subset of such establishments?where private sector nonfarm employers indicate that 50 or more workers were separated from their jobs for at least 31 days.
Keywords: Layoffs Statistics, Mass Layoffs

Title: National Compensation Survey
Description: The National Compensation Survey (NCS) provides comprehensive measures of occupational wages; employment cost trends, and benefit incidence and detailed plan provisions. Detailed occupational earnings are available for metropolitan and non-metropolitan areas, broad geographic regions, and on a national basis. The index component of the NCS (ECI) measures changes in labor costs. Average hourly employer cost for employee compensation is presented in the ECEC.
Keywords: Compensation Statistics

Title: National Longitudinal Surveys
Time Period: Multiple years of data are averaged
Description: The National Longitudinal Surveys (NLS) are a set of surveys designed to gather information at multiple points in time on the labor market activities and other significant life events of several groups of men and women. For more than 4 decades, NLS data have served as an important tool for economists, sociologists, and other researchers.
Keywords: Longitudinal data, National Longitudinal Surveys

Title: Occupational Outlook Handbook
Description: The Occupational Outlook Handbook is a nationally recognized source of career information, designed to provide valuable assistance to individuals making decisions about their future work lives. The Handbook is revised every two years.
Keywords: Occupational Outlook Handbook

Title: Occupational Employment Statistics
Description: The Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) program produces employment and wage estimates for over 800 occupations. These are estimates of the number of people employed in certain occupations, and estimates of the wages paid to them. Self-employed persons are not included in the estimates. These estimates are available for the nation as a whole, for individual States, and for metropolitan and nonmetropolitan areas; national occupational estimates for specific industries are also available.
Keywords: Employment by occupation, Occupational employment and wages
Unit of Analysis: Employment by occupation, Occupational employment and wages

Title: Producer Price Indexes
Time Period: Tuesday of the week containing the 13th day of the month
Description: The Producer Price Index (PPI) program measures the average change over time in the selling prices received by domestic producers for their output. The prices included in the PPI are from the first commercial transaction for many products and some services.
Keywords: Producer price indexes, Wholesale Inflation, Wholesale price index
Unit of Analysis: Producer price indexes, Wholesale Inflation, Wholesale price index

Keywords: Inflation and Consumer Spending, Employment and Unemployment, Pay and Benefits, Workplace Injuries

Title: Employment, Hours, and Earnings from the Current Employment Statistics survey (State and Metro Area)
Time Period: Employment and wages for the pay period including the 12th of the month
Description: Each month the Current Employment Statistics (CES) program surveys about 150,000 businesses and government agencies, representing approximately 390,000 individual worksites, in order to provide detailed industry data on employment, hours, and earnings of workers on nonfarm payrolls for all 50 States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and over 300 metropolitan areas and divisions.
Keywords: State and metropolitan area employment statistics (establishment survey), Experimental all employee hours and earnings series, by state
Unit of Analysis: State and metropolitan area employment statistics (establishment survey), Experimental all employee hours and earnings series, by state

Title: Standard Occupational Classification
Description: The Standard Occupational Classification (SOC) system is used by Federal statistical agencies to classify workers into occupational categories for the purpose of collecting, calculating, or disseminating data. All workers are classified into one of over 820 occupations according to their occupational definition.
Keywords: Occupational classification, Standard Occupational Classification (SOC)

Title: American Time User Survey
Description: The American Time Use Survey (ATUS) measures the amount of time people spend doing various activities, such as paid work, childcare, volunteering, and socializing.
Keywords: American Time Use Survey

Title: Work Stoppages
Description: The Work Stoppages program provides monthly and annual data and analysis of major work stoppages involving 1,000 or more workers lasting one full shift or longer. The monthly and annual data show the establishment and union(s) involved in the work stoppage along with the location, the number of workers and the days of idleness. The monthly data list all work stoppages involving 1,000 or more workers that occurred during the full calendar month for each month of the year. The annualized data provide statistics, analysis and details of each work stoppage of 1,000 or more workers that occurred during the year. The work stoppages data are gathered from public news sources, such as newspapers and the Internet. The BLS does not distinguish between strikes and lock-outs in the data; both are included in the term "work stoppages".
Keywords: Strike, Labor dispute, Labor management dispute, Lockout, Slowdown, Work stoppages
Unit of Analysis: Strike, Labor dispute, Labor management dispute, Lockout, Slowdown, Work stoppages

Title: Multifamily Assistance Section 8 Contracts
Agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
Description: This database represents the most comprehensive picture of project-based subsidies.  It was created to provide HUD partners/clients with a way of measuring the potential impact of expiring project-based subsidy contracts in their communities.
Keywords: Low-Income Housing, housing assistance, geocode, Multifamily Assistance, Section Eight,  Section 8, Section 8 Contracts, FHA, HUD, Fair Market Rents, Census Tract
Granularity: ZIP Code, Census Tract, Street Address.
Data Collection Instrument: Database is built through a series of standard queries that pulls and organizes data from the Multifamily Portfolio Reporting Database (MPRD)

Title: Interactive access to the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
Description: Quarterly and annual estimates of transactions with foreigners, including trade in goods and services, receipts and payments of income, transfers, and transactions in financial assets.
Keywords: Balance of Payments
Collection Mode: Surveys and data from other statistical agencies.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Department of Commerce, Bureau of Economic Analysis

Title: State Library Agency Survey: Fiscal Year 2006
Agency: Institute of Museum and Library Services
Description: This dataset is a national census of state library agencies.  A state library agency is the official agency of a state that is charged by state law with the extension and development of public library services throughout the state and that has adequate authority under state law to administer state plans in accordance with the provisions of the Library Services and Technology Act (LSTA).  Beyond these two roles, state library agencies vary greatly.  This dataset provides information on the range of roles played by state library agencies and the various combinations of fiscal, human, and informational resources invested in such work.
Keywords: State Libraries Survey, State Library Survey, State Library Agencies, IMLS, IMLS Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services, State Library Data Files, IMLS Library Statistics, State Library Statistics, Library Statistics
Geographic Coverage: The United States:  All 50 States and The District of Columbia
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Institute of Museum and Library Services

Agency: Institute of Museum and Library Services
Description: This dataset is a national census of state library agencies.  A state library agency is the official agency of a state that is charged by state law with the extension and development of public library services throughout the state and that has adequate authority under state law to administer state plans in accordance with the provisions of the Library Services and Technology Act (LSTA).  Beyond these two roles, state library agencies vary greatly.  This dataset provides information on the range of roles played by state library agencies and the various combinations of fiscal, human, and informational resources invested in such work.
Keywords: State Libraries Survey, State Library Survey, State Library Agencies, IMLS, IMLS Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services, State Library Data Files, IMLS Library Statistics, State Library Statistics, Library Statistics
Citation: Bittner, M., Manjarrez, C., Miller, K., Dorinski, S., Freeman, M., Music, C., O'Shea, P., Sheckells, C. (2008). Data File: State Library Agencies Survey: Fiscal Year 2007 (IMLS-2008-StLA-01). Institute of Museum and Library Services. Washington, DC
Geographic Coverage: The United States:  All 50 States and The District of Columbia
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Institute of Museum and Library Services

Title: ECOTOX Knowledgebase
Time Period: Data are available for publication years 1915 to present
Description: ECOTOX is the largest database compilation of ecotoxicity information in the world, providing data on the adverse effects of single chemical stressors to ecologically relevant aquatic and terrestrial species.  The primary source of ECOTOX data is the peer-reviewed literature, resulting from comprehensive searches of the open literature followed by abstraction and review of data that meet minimum data quality requirements.  ECOTOX also includes third-party data collections from U.S. EPA Program Offices, the U.S. Geologic Survey, Russia, and OECD member nations.  Data are not interpreted during the coding process, representing the information on species, chemicals, test methods and toxicity results as presented by the author(s).
Keywords: Toxicology, Aquatic, Terrestrial, Toxic Effects, Adverse Effects, Ecotoxicology, Ecological Effects Data, ECOTOX Database, Pollution Prevention, EPA
Citation: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. 2009. ECOTOX Release 4.0. http://www.epa.gov/ecotox/.
Unit of Analysis: Each data records includes information available on chemical tested (e.g., CAS Registry number, synonyms, formulation, purity, solvent, etc.), species tested (e.g., scientific and common names, taxonomic hierarchy, age, sex, weight, length, etc.), test methods used (e.g., route and duration of exposure, concentration, dose or application rate, study location, control type, etc.), test results (e.g., observed effect, calculated endpoint, statistics, dose response, etc.) and the source of the data (e.g., complete citation).
Granularity: For field study data reported in the databases, lat/long provided

Title: Public Libraries Survey: Fiscal Year 2006
Agency: Institute of Museum and Library Services
Description: This dataset is a national census of public library systems.  Its data elements cover library service measures such as the number of uses of electronic resources, the number of Internet terminals available to the general public, reference transactions, interlibrary loans, circulation, library visits, children's program attendance, and circulation of children's materials. It also includes information on collection sizes, staffing, operating revenue and expenditures.  Selected data elements are aggregated and summarized at the state level.
Keywords: IMLS, IMLS Statistics, IMLS Library Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services, Public Library Data Files, Public Libraries Survey, Public Library Survey, Public Library Statistics, Library Statistics
Citation: Miller, K., Manjarrez, C., Henderson, E., Craig, T., Dorinski, S., Freeman, M., Keng, J., McKenzie, L., OfShea, P., Ramsey, C., Sheckells, C. (2008). Data File: Public Libraries Survey: Fiscal Year 2006 (IMLS-2008-PLS-01). Institute of Museum and Library Services. Washington, DC
Unit of Analysis: Public Library System, Public Library Outlets (Branches), State
Geographic Coverage: The United States:  All 50 States and The District of Columbia; Guam, the Northern Marianas and the Virgin Islands
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Institute of Museum and Library Services

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Bills Rates (Current month)
Description: Daily Treasury Bill Rates: These rates are the daily secondary market quotation on the most recently auctioned Treasury Bills for each maturity tranche (4-week, 13-week, 26-week, and 52-week) that Treasury currently issues new Bills. Market quotations are obtained at approximately 3:30 PM each business day by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. The Bank Discount rate is the rate at which a Bill is quoted in the secondary market and is based on the par value, amount of the discount and a 360-day year. The Coupon Equivalent, also called the Bond Equivalent, or the Investment Yield, is the bill's yield based on the purchase price, discount, and a 365- or 366-day year. The Coupon Equivalent can be used to compare the yield on a discount bill to the yield on a nominal coupon bond that pays semiannual interest.
Keywords: statistics, interest, rates, yield, yield curve, daily yield curve, real yield curve, interest rates, aa

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Long-Term Rates (Current month)
Description: Treasury Long-Term Average Rate and Extrapolation Factors. Beginning February 18, 2002, Treasury ceased publication of the 30-year constant maturity series. Instead, from February 19, 2002 through May 28, 2004, Treasury published a Long-Term Average Rate, "LT>25," (not to be confused with the Long-Term Composite Rate, definitions below). In addition, Treasury published daily linear extrapolation factors that could be added to the Long-Term Average Rate to allow interested parties to compute an estimated 30-year rate. On June 1, 2004, Treasury discontinued the "LT>25" average due to a dearth of eligible bonds. In place of the "LT>25" average, Treasury published the Treasury 20-year Constant Maturity rate on this page along with an extrapolation factor that was added to the 20-year Constant Maturity to obtain an estimate for a theoretical 30-year rate. On February 9, 2006, Treasury reintroduced the 30-year constant maturity and is no longer publishing the extrapolation factor.
Keywords: LT, composite, treasury, extrapolation, factor, date, average

Keywords: LT, composite, treasury, extrapolation, factor, date, average

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Real Long Term Rates (Current month)
Description: Long Term Real Rate Average: The Long-Term Real Rate Average is the unweighted average of bid real yields on all outstanding TIPS with remaing maturities of more than 10 years and is intended as a proxy for long-term real rates.
Keywords: long, term, real, average, rate, unweighted, LT, bid

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Real Long Term Rates (2003 - Current Year)

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Real Yield Curve Rates (Current month)
Description: Treasury Real Yield Curve Rates. These rates are commonly referred to as "Real Constant Maturity Treasury" rates, or R-CMTs. Real yields on Treasury TIPS (Treasury Inflation Protected Securities) at "constant maturity" are interpolated by the U.S. Treasury from Treasury's daily real yield curve. These real market yields are calculated from composites of secondary market quotations obtained by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. The real yield values are read from the real yield curve at fixed maturities, currently 5, 7, 10 and 20 years. This method provides a real yield for a 7 year maturity, for example, even if no outstanding security has exactly 7 years remaining to maturity.
Keywords: statistics, interest, rates, yield, yield curve, daily yield curve, real yield curve, interest rates, aa
Unit of Analysis: Daily Treasury Real Yield Curve Rates

Title: Interest Rate Statistics - Daily Treasury Yield Curve Rates (Current month)
Description: Treasury Yield Curve Rates. These rates are commonly referred to as "Constant Maturity Treasury" rates, or CMTs. Yields are interpolated by the Treasury from the daily yield curve. This curve, which relates the yield on a security to its time to maturity is based on the closing market bid yields on actively traded Treasury securities in the over-the-counter market. These market yields are calculated from composites of quotations obtained by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. The yield values are read from the yield curve at fixed maturities, currently 1, 3 and 6 months and 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 10, 20, and 30 years. This method provides a yield for a 10 year maturity, for example, even if no outstanding security has exactly 10 years remaining to maturity.
Keywords: statistics, interest, rates, yield, yield curve, daily yield curve, real yield curve, interest rates, aa

These market yields are calculated from composites of quotations obtained by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. The yield values are read from the yield curve at fixed maturities, currently 1, 3 and 6 months and 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 10, 20, and 30 years. This method provides a yield for a 10 year maturity, for example, even if no outstanding security has exactly 10 years remaining to maturity.
Keywords: statistics, interest, rates, yield, yield curve, daily yield curve, real yield curve, interest rates, aa

Title: IT Dashboard - Federal IT Spending (all investments)
Description: This feed provides updated data about every investment in the Federal IT Portfolio. The information includes current year spending data, a description of each investment, and what type of mission it supports.
Keywords: budget, it, information technology, technology, spending, cio, exhibit 53, exhibit 300, omb
Unit of Analysis: IT Investment, as described in OMB Circular A-11, Section 53.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Information is compiled from public Exhibit 53 data submitted by each investment's agency. The submitting agency is responsible for the information quality of the Exhibit 53.

Title: IT Dashboard - Federal IT Spending (major investments only)
Description: This feed provides updated data about every major investment in the Federal IT Portfolio. The information includes current year spending data, a description of each investment, what type of mission it supports, whether the investment is on GAO's high risk list, and the investment's Evaluation (By Agency CIO).
Keywords: budget, it, information technology, technology, spending, cio, exhibit 53, exhibit 300, omb
Unit of Analysis: IT Investment, as described in OMB Circular A-11, Section 300.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Information is compiled from public Exhibit 53 data submitted by each investment's agency. The submitting agency is responsible for the information quality of the Exhibit 53.

Title: IT Dashboard - Agencies' Progress On CIO Evaluations
Description: This feed provides dynamic data about how many Evaluations (By Agency CIO) each agency has submitted to the IT Dashboard. As part of the calculation for the overall rating of every major IT investment in the federal government, these evaluations are a crucial contribution by each agency.
Keywords: budget, it, information technology, technology, spending, cio, exhibit 53, exhibit 300, omb
Unit of Analysis: IT Investment, as described in OMB Circular A-11, Section 300.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Information is compiled from public Exhibit 53 data submitted by each investment's agency. The submitting agency is responsible for the information quality of the Exhibit 53.

Title: IT Dashboard - Federal IT Investment Performance
Time Period: Varies. Detailed data for FY2008-2010, complete performance data for FY2009, summary data for FY2001-FY2010
Description: The IT Dashboard provides the public with an online window into the details of Federal information technology investments and provides users with the ability to track the progress of investments over time. The IT Dashboard displays data received from agency reports to the Office of Management and Budget (OMB), including general information on over 7,000 Federal IT investments and detailed data for nearly 800 of those investments that agencies classify as "major". The performance data used to track the 800 major IT investments is based on milestone information displayed in agency reports to OMB called "Exhibit 300s" Agency CIOs are responsible for evaluating and updating select data on a monthly basis, which is accomplished through interfaces provided on the website.
Keywords: budget, it, information technology, technology, spending, cio, exhibit 53, exhibit 300, omb, visualization
Unit of Analysis: IT Investment, as described in OMB Circular A-11, Section 300.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Information is compiled from public Exhibit 53 and Exhibit 300 data submitted by each investment's agency. The submitting agency is responsible for the information quality of the Exhibit 53 and Exhibit 300.

Title: Treasury Securities Auction Results

Keywords: Auction results, Treasury securities auction results, Treasury bill auction results, Treasury Notes auction results, Treasury Bonds auction results, TIPS auction results

Title: National Prosecutors Survey [Census], 2001
Description: The National Survey of Prosecutors is a survey of chief prosecutors in state court systems. It was previously conducted in 1990, 1992, 1994, and 1996 (ICPSR 9579, 6273, 6785, 2433 respectively). For 2001, instead of a survey of chief prosecutors, a census of all 2,341 chief prosecutors who handled felony cases in state courts of general jurisdiction was conducted. A chief prosecutor is an official, usually locally elected and typically with the title of district attorney or county attorney, who is in charge of a prosecutorial district made up of one or more counties, and who conducts or supervises the prosecution of felony cases in a state court system. Prosecutors in courts of limited jurisdiction, such as municipal prosecutors, were not included in the survey. The census' purpose was to obtain detailed descriptive information on prosecutors' offices, as well as information on their policies and practices. Variables cover staffing, funding, special categories of felony prosecutions, caseload, juvenile matters, work-related threats or assaults, the use of DNA evidence, and community-related activities, such as involvement in neighborhood associations.   The unit of analysis is the district office.
Keywords: attorneys, case processing, district attorneys, evidence, felony, felony courts, plea negotiations, prosecuting attorneys, prosecution, policies and procedures, sentencing, state courts, trial procedures
Citation: U.S. Dept. of Justice, Bureau of Justice Statistics. NATIONAL PROSECUTORS SURVEY [CENSUS], 2001 [Computer file]. Conducted by the National Opinion Research Center. ICPSR03418-v1. Ann Arbor, MI: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research [producer and distributor], 2002. doi:10.3886/ICPSR03418
Unit of Analysis: Chief litigating prosecutor in a state court
Collection Mode: self-enumerated questionnaires, and telephone interviews for offices not initially reported

Title: Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS), 2000
Description: Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS), conducted every 3 to 4 years, collects data from over 3,000 State and local law enforcement agencies, including all those that employ 100 or more sworn officers and a nationally representative sample of smaller agencies. Data are obtained on the organization and administration of police and sheriffs' departments including agency responsibilities, operating expenditures, job functions of sworn and civilian employees, officer salaries and special pay, demographic characteristics of officers, weapons and armor policies, education and training requirements, computers and information systems, vehicles, special units, and community policing activities.
Keywords: administration, budgets, employees, law enforcement, law enforcement agencies, management, personnel, police departments, statistical data, wages and salaries
Citation: United States Department of Justice. Bureau of Justice Statistics. Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS): 2000 Sample Survey of Law Enforcement Agencies [Computer file]. ICPSR03565-v2. Ann Arbor, MI: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research [distributor], 2008-12-04. doi:10.3886/ICPSR03565

Title: Public Libraries Survey: Fiscal Year 2007
Agency: Institute of Museum and Library Services
Description: This dataset is a national census of public library systems.  Its data elements cover library service measures such as the number of uses of electronic resources, the number of Internet terminals available to the general public, reference transactions, interlibrary loans, circulation, library visits, children's program attendance, and circulation of children's materials. It also includes information on collection sizes, staffing, operating revenue and expenditures.  Selected data elements are aggregated and summarized at the state level.
Keywords: IMLS, IMLS Statistics, IMLS Library Statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services statistics, Institute of Museum and Library Services, Public Library Data Files, Public Libraries Survey, Public Library Survey, Public Library Statistics, Library Statistics
Citation: Henderson, E., Miller, K., Craig, T., Dorinski, S., Freeman, M., Isaac, N., Keng, J., McKenzie, L., O'Shea, P., Ramsey, C., Sheckells, C. (2009). Public Libraries Survey: Fiscal Year 2007. Institute of Museum and Library Services. Washington, DC
Unit of Analysis: Public Library System, Public Library Outlets (Branches), State
Geographic Coverage: The United States:  All 50 States and The District of Columbia; Guam, the Northern Marianas and the Virgin Islands
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: Institute of Museum and Library Services

Title: Multiprobe Water Quality Data from the Tracy Fish Collection Facility (TFCF), Byron, California
Description: Currently Available Period of Record: April 1, 2000 through February 15, 2007.  This program has produced seven years of water quality multiprobe data at the TFCF since April 2000.
Keywords: Multiprobe, Water, Quality, Tracy, Fish, Collection, Facility, TFCF, Byron, California
Citation: Water quality and additional supplemental data associated with fishery research investigations conducted at the Tracy Fish Collection Facility, Tracy, California http://www.usbr.gov/pmts/tech_services/tracy_research/data/WaterQualityData.html
Unit of Analysis: waters of the Old River located at the intake structures of the TFCF, Byron, California
Granularity: data were collected with a multi-parameter water quality sonde installed in a perforated pipe located behind the trash rack and intake structures of the TFCF, Byron, California
Geographic Coverage: data were collected with a multi-parameter water quality sonde installed in a perforated pipe located behind the trash rack and intake structures of the TFCF, Byron, California
Collection Mode: The original sonde was the Hydrolab (now Hach? Environmental) DataSonde 4a that used the Surveyor 4a data logger. In 2005, the Hydrolab sonde was replaced with a Yellow Springs Instruments, Inc. (YSI) model QS 600 sonde and the model 650 Multiparameter Display System.  The sonde readings were stored on internal probe memory and downloaded as ASCII text files, then imported into Microsoft? Excel for analysis.
Applicable Agency Information Quality Gu: USBR does not presently require data quality certification.

Title: Earth Observations -Astronaut Photography
Date Updated: Continually updated as imagery is downlinked.
Description: The Gateway to Astronaut Photography of Earth database of images hosts the best and most complete online collection of astronaut photographs of the Earth.
Keywords: Earth Observations, Gateway, Astronaut, Photography, Earth, Mercury Missions, Space Station, images, photographs,
Unit of Analysis: Image of photogaph taken by astronaut of somewhere on Earth

Title: ACToR: Aggregated Computational Toxicology Resource
Description: ACToR is a tool for searching a data warehouse containing data on chemicals of environmental concern, aggregated from several hundred publicly available sources, many developed by the U.S. government. Data has been extracted from a variety of non-compatible formats and compiled to allow look-across chemical-by-chemical or data source by data source. Data can be searched by a variety of chemical names and codes as well as by chemical structure.
Keywords: chemical, chemicals, chemistry, toxicology, compound, compounds, toxic, toxics

Title: TRI.NET data engine for EPA Toxics Release Inventory
Description: TRI.NET ("T-R-I-dot-net") is a new application developed by EPA to help you analyze Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) information. This application is capable of easily and quickly performing complex queries to help you understand TRI information. It is especially useful for analysts who need a highly interactive environment in order to refine their queries and analyses in an efficient and productive way. TRI.NET makes heavy use of mashups using the latest mapping technologies to help visualize where TRI releases are occurring.
Keywords: TRI.NET, Toxics Release Inventory, TRI, EPA, Toxic, Desktop Application, Emissions, Facilities
Citation: TRI.NET data engine for EPA Toxics Release Inventory, http://www.epa.gov/tri/tridotnet/installer.msi
Unit of Analysis: Quantities and other characteristics of  releases and other waste management activities (recycling, energy recovery and treatement) for a single TRI chemical by a TRI qualifying facility.

Title: National Census of Ferry Operators
Description: Contains information on each ferry vessel, route segments, passenger/vehicle boardings, peak periods, modal connectivity, terminal information
Keywords: ferry, census, transporation
Unit of Analysis: ferry operators providing itinerant, fixed route, common carrier passenger and/or vehicle roll-on, roll-off (RoRo) ferry service.  Railroad car float operations are also included.
Geographic Coverage: ferry operators in the U.S. and its possessions and operators providing services from locations in the U.S. and its possessions to and from a foreign country.
Statistical Methodology: This is a descriptive data set
Sampling: This was a census survey--no sampling was done
Estimation: This is a descriptive data set
Weighting: This is a census survey--no weighting was done
Non-response Adjustment: NA--this is a census with >90% response rate
